1.text: Therefore, as most beloved sons, be imitators of God.

2.text: And walk in love, just as Christ also loved us and delivered himself for us, as an oblation and a sacrifice to God, with a fragrance of sweetness.

3.text: But let not any kind of fornication, or impurity, or rapacity so much as be named among you, just as is worthy of the saints,

4.text: nor any indecent, or foolish, or abusive talk, for this is without purpose; but instead, give thanks.

5.text: For know and understand this: no one who is a fornicator, or lustful, or rapacious (for these are a kind of service to idols) holds an inheritance in the kingdom of Christ and of God.

6.text: Let no one seduce you with empty words. For because of these things, the wrath of God was sent upon the sons of unbelief.

7.text: Therefore, do not choose to become participants with them.

8.text: For you were darkness, in times past, but now you are light, in the Lord. So then, walk as sons of the light.

9.text: For the fruit of the light is in all goodness and justice and truth,

10.text: affirming what is well-pleasing to God.

11.text: And so, have no fellowship with the unfruitful works of darkness, but instead, refute them.

12.text: For the things that are done by them in secret are shameful, even to mention.

13.text: But all things that are disputed are made manifest by the light. For all that is made manifest is light.

14.text: Because of this, it is said: “You who are sleeping: awaken, and rise up from the dead, and so shall the Christ enlighten you.”

15.text: And so, brothers, see to it that you walk cautiously, not like the foolish,

16.text: but like the wise: atoning for this age, because this is an evil time.

17.text: For this reason, do not choose to be imprudent. Instead, understand what is the will of God.

18.text: And do not choose to be inebriated by wine, for this is self-indulgence. Instead, be filled with the Holy Spirit,

19.text: speaking among yourselves in psalms and hymns and spiritual canticles, singing and reciting psalms to the Lord in your hearts,

20.text: giving thanks always for everything, in the name of our Lord Jesus Christ, to God the Father.

21.text: Be subject to one another in the fear of Christ.

22.text: Wives should be submissive to their husbands, as to the Lord.

23.text: For the husband is the head of the wife, just as Christ is the head of the Church. He is the Savior of his body.

24.text: Therefore, just as the Church is subject to Christ, so also should wives be subject to their husbands in all things.

25.text: Husbands, love your wives, just as Christ also loved the Church and handed himself over for her,

26.text: so that he might sanctify her, washing her clean by water and the Word of life,

27.text: so that he might offer her to himself as a glorious Church, not having any spot or wrinkle or any such thing, so that she would be holy and immaculate.

28.text: So, too, husbands should love their wives as their own bodies. He who loves his wife loves himself.

29.text: For no man has ever hated his own flesh, but instead he nourishes and cherishes it, as Christ also does to the Church.

30.text: For we are a part of his body, of his flesh and of his bones.

31.text: “For this reason, a man shall leave behind his father and mother, and he shall cling to his wife; and the two shall be as one flesh.”

32.text: This is a great Sacrament. And I am speaking in Christ and in the Church.

33.text: Yet truly, each and every one of you should love his wife as himself. And a wife should fear her husband.
